org.forgerock.opendj.rest2ldap

Class Rest2LDAP.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.opendj.rest2ldap.Rest2LDAP.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    Rest2LDAP

    public static final class Rest2LDAP.Builder
extends Object
    A builder for incrementally constructing LDAP resource collections.

    • Method Detail

      • additionalLDAPAttribute

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder additionalLDAPAttribute(Attribute attribute)
        Specifies an additional LDAP attribute which should be included with new LDAP entries when they are created. Use this method to specify the LDAP objectClass attribute.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The additional LDAP attribute to be included with new LDAP entries.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • additionalLDAPAttribute

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder additionalLDAPAttribute(String attribute,
                                        Object... values)
        Specifies an additional LDAP attribute which should be included with new LDAP entries when they are created. Use this method to specify the LDAP objectClass attribute.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The name of the additional LDAP attribute to be included with new LDAP entries.
        values - The value(s) of the additional LDAP attribute.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • authorizationPolicy

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder authorizationPolicy(AuthorizationPolicy policy)
        Sets the policy which should be for performing authorization.
        Parameters:
        policy - The policy which should be for performing authorization.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • baseDN

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder baseDN(DN dn)
        Sets the base DN beneath which LDAP entries (resources) are to be found.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder baseDN(String dn)
        Sets the base DN beneath which LDAP entries (resources) are to be found.

      • build

        public org.forgerock.json.resource.CollectionResourceProvider build()
        Creates a new LDAP resource collection configured using this builder.
        Returns:
        The new LDAP resource collection.

      • configureMapping

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder configureMapping(org.forgerock.json.fluent.JsonValue configuration)
        Configures the JSON to LDAP mapping using the provided JSON configuration. The caller is still required to set the connection factory. See the sample configuration file for a detailed description of its content.
        Parameters:
        configuration - The JSON configuration.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the configuration is invalid.

      • ldapConnectionFactory

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder ldapConnectionFactory(ConnectionFactory factory)
        Sets the LDAP connection factory to be used for accessing the LDAP directory. Each HTTP request will obtain a single connection from the factory and then close it once the HTTP response has been sent. It is recommended that the provided connection factory supports connection pooling.
        Parameters:
        factory - The LDAP connection factory to be used for accessing the LDAP directory.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • mapper

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder mapper(AttributeMapper mapper)
        Sets the attribute mapper which should be used for mapping JSON resources to and from LDAP entries.
        Parameters:
        mapper - The attribute mapper.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • proxyAuthzIdTemplate

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder proxyAuthzIdTemplate(String template)
        Sets the authorization ID template which will be used for proxied authorization. Template parameters are specified by including the parameter name surrounded by curly braces. The template should contain fields which are expected to be found in the security context create during authentication, e.g. "dn:{dn}" or "u:{id}".
        Parameters:
        template - The authorization ID template which will be used for proxied authorization.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • readOnUpdatePolicy

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder readOnUpdatePolicy(ReadOnUpdatePolicy policy)
        Sets the policy which should be used in order to read an entry before it is deleted, or after it is added or modified. The default read on update policy is to use controls.
        Parameters:
        policy - The policy which should be used in order to read an entry before it is deleted, or after it is added or modified.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • schema

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder schema(Schema schema)
        Sets the schema which should be used when attribute types and controls.
        Parameters:
        schema - The schema which should be used when attribute types and controls.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useClientDNNaming

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useClientDNNaming(AttributeType attribute)
        Indicates that the JSON resource ID must be provided by the user, and will be used for naming the associated LDAP entry. More specifically, LDAP entry names will be derived by appending a single RDN to the base DN composed of the specified attribute type and LDAP value taken from the LDAP entry once attribute mapping has been performed.

        Note that this naming policy requires that the user provides the resource name when creating new resources, which means it must be included in the resource content when not specified explicitly in the create request.

        Parameters:
        attribute - The LDAP attribute which will be used for naming.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useClientDNNaming

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useClientDNNaming(String attribute)
        Indicates that the JSON resource ID must be provided by the user, and will be used for naming the associated LDAP entry. More specifically, LDAP entry names will be derived by appending a single RDN to the base DN composed of the specified attribute type and LDAP value taken from the LDAP entry once attribute mapping has been performed.

        Note that this naming policy requires that the user provides the resource name when creating new resources, which means it must be included in the resource content when not specified explicitly in the create request.

        Parameters:
        attribute - The LDAP attribute which will be used for naming.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useClientNaming

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useClientNaming(AttributeType dnAttribute,
                                AttributeDescription idAttribute)
        Indicates that the JSON resource ID must be provided by the user, but will not be used for naming the associated LDAP entry. Instead the JSON resource ID will be taken from the idAttribute in the LDAP entry, and the LDAP entry name will be derived by appending a single RDN to the base DN composed of the dnAttribute taken from the LDAP entry once attribute mapping has been performed.

        Note that this naming policy requires that the user provides the resource name when creating new resources, which means it must be included in the resource content when not specified explicitly in the create request.

        Parameters:
        dnAttribute - The attribute which will be used for naming LDAP entries.
        idAttribute - The attribute which will be used for JSON resource IDs.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useClientNaming

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useClientNaming(String dnAttribute,
                                String idAttribute)
        Indicates that the JSON resource ID must be provided by the user, but will not be used for naming the associated LDAP entry. Instead the JSON resource ID will be taken from the idAttribute in the LDAP entry, and the LDAP entry name will be derived by appending a single RDN to the base DN composed of the dnAttribute taken from the LDAP entry once attribute mapping has been performed.

        Note that this naming policy requires that the user provides the resource name when creating new resources, which means it must be included in the resource content when not specified explicitly in the create request.

        Parameters:
        dnAttribute - The attribute which will be used for naming LDAP entries.
        idAttribute - The attribute which will be used for JSON resource IDs.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useEtagAttribute

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useEtagAttribute()
        Indicates that the "etag" LDAP attribute should be used for resource versioning. This is the default behavior.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useEtagAttribute

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useEtagAttribute(AttributeDescription attribute)
        Indicates that the provided LDAP attribute should be used for resource versioning. The "etag" attribute will be used by default.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The name of the attribute to use for versioning, or null if resource versioning will not supported.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useEtagAttribute

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useEtagAttribute(String attribute)
        Indicates that the provided LDAP attribute should be used for resource versioning. The "etag" attribute will be used by default.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The name of the attribute to use for versioning, or null if resource versioning will not supported.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • usePermissiveModify

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder usePermissiveModify()
        Indicates that all LDAP modify operations should be performed using the LDAP permissive modify control. The default behavior is to not use the permissive modify control. Use of the control is strongly recommended.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useServerEntryUUIDNaming

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useServerEntryUUIDNaming(AttributeType dnAttribute)
        Indicates that the JSON resource ID will be derived from the server provided "entryUUID" LDAP attribute. The LDAP entry name will be derived by appending a single RDN to the base DN composed of the dnAttribute taken from the LDAP entry once attribute mapping has been performed.

        Note that this naming policy requires that the server provides the resource name when creating new resources, which means it must not be specified in the create request, nor included in the resource content.

        Parameters:
        dnAttribute - The attribute which will be used for naming LDAP entries.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useServerEntryUUIDNaming

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useServerEntryUUIDNaming(String dnAttribute)
        Indicates that the JSON resource ID will be derived from the server provided "entryUUID" LDAP attribute. The LDAP entry name will be derived by appending a single RDN to the base DN composed of the dnAttribute taken from the LDAP entry once attribute mapping has been performed.

        Note that this naming policy requires that the server provides the resource name when creating new resources, which means it must not be specified in the create request, nor included in the resource content.

        Parameters:
        dnAttribute - The attribute which will be used for naming LDAP entries.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useServerNaming

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useServerNaming(AttributeType dnAttribute,
                                AttributeDescription idAttribute)
        Indicates that the JSON resource ID must not be provided by the user, and will not be used for naming the associated LDAP entry. Instead the JSON resource ID will be taken from the idAttribute in the LDAP entry, and the LDAP entry name will be derived by appending a single RDN to the base DN composed of the dnAttribute taken from the LDAP entry once attribute mapping has been performed.

        Note that this naming policy requires that the server provides the resource name when creating new resources, which means it must not be specified in the create request, nor included in the resource content.

        Parameters:
        dnAttribute - The attribute which will be used for naming LDAP entries.
        idAttribute - The attribute which will be used for JSON resource IDs.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useServerNaming

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useServerNaming(String dnAttribute,
                                String idAttribute)
        Indicates that the JSON resource ID must not be provided by the user, and will not be used for naming the associated LDAP entry. Instead the JSON resource ID will be taken from the idAttribute in the LDAP entry, and the LDAP entry name will be derived by appending a single RDN to the base DN composed of the dnAttribute taken from the LDAP entry once attribute mapping has been performed.

        Note that this naming policy requires that the server provides the resource name when creating new resources, which means it must not be specified in the create request, nor included in the resource content.

        Parameters:
        dnAttribute - The attribute which will be used for naming LDAP entries.
        idAttribute - The attribute which will be used for JSON resource IDs.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.

      • useSubtreeDelete

        public Rest2LDAP.Builder useSubtreeDelete()
        Indicates that all LDAP delete operations should be performed using the LDAP subtree delete control. The default behavior is to not use the subtree delete control.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP resource collection builder.
